text: Sir Henry Hallett Dale, OM, GBE, PRS, (9 June 1875 - 23 July 1968) was an English pharmacologist. He won the 1936 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with Otto Loewi, for their discoveries about the chemical transmission of nerve impulses. ==References== Category:1875 births Category:1968 deaths Category:British pharmacologists Category:Order of Merit Category:Knights and Dames Grand Cross of the Order of the British Empire Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Presidents of the Royal Society Category:British Nobel Prize winners
title: Henry Hallett Dale
